bow:
is there still hope my month old son has fairly severe eczema because of this ca sleep train him if he left alone with no stimulus he will scratch himself until he bleeds rock him to sleep for every nap and every night for bed starting to gain control of his eczema after specialists different creams and ointments and countless bath time routine changes so hopeful the rocking will be able to decrease bit before go back to work in october and he goes to daycare just wondering for those who did sleep train when did your lo become able to get themselves to sleep do love the sleepy snuggles but do think my daycare would have the time to rock him to sleep okay do kill me if you have literally heard this million times but since you have brought it up have you tried using aveeno on him had severe eczema as child granted though just on my legs and the doctor recommended it and it cleared it up for me that what we started with he ended up having an allergic reaction to it we use cerave cream and aquaphor minimum times day now and he staying moisturized oh am sorry and sorry do have any answers to help you best of luck mama no worries it been quite struggle with the eczema and know lot of others struggle with it too just thankful we finally found something that helps good luck with yours too my son has mild eczema and also loves scratching himself we use steroid cream now based with super moisturizing cream but now on to your question put my son in sleep sack so he pretty much can only get to his neck we did sleep train for while but he was always sick due to ear infections and we became little too laid back with it and now he is back to his old sleeping patterns he is 14 months now and he still doesn sleep trough the night but due to the sleep training he can fall asleep by himself during the day maybe if you get sleep sack you could give sleep training go too but if not don fear my son went to daycare way before he was sleep trained and he just passes out there from all the impressions and playing maybe you could ask your future daycare for advice too that sounds really hard did have eczema as baby but had it in my adolescence and college and know how hard it is to not scratch when you re asleep even at much older age never had success with moisturizers it was until friend of mine gave me very strong steroid cream that his sister had as prescription from private doctor that was able to cure my eczema wish could remember the name of it one of the difficulties think though only based on my own experience is that lot of things dermotologists recommend make the eczema worse until you finally find something strong enough to work do have good suggestions either but just wanted to let you know that understand little bit how hard it has been know you ve probably tried million things but here are some ideas 
* use white noise at night 
* behavior modification during the day to work on not scratching 
* run the fan at night to keep the area cooler 
* do cover the affected area depending on where the flare up occurs for me it was the inside of the elbows 
* keep nails short 
* keep hands in mittens at night 
* after rocking him to sleep wake him up little in the crib so he gets practice putting himself to sleep watch him until he falls asleep and if he ca fall asleep pick him up rock him and try again 
 when the area fully heals it will be less itchy so keep hope alive until then best of luck momma it mostly his head and face that are the itchiest ve been trying to find something better than the little mittens we use to at least protect him from his scratching we have sleeveless sleep sack but obviously that not much help ll definitely ask the daycare people what they think that good idea thanks for the input we tried various steroid creams but because he so little they could make them very strong we got nonsteroidal cream and it been working really well it called protopic what kind of behaviour modification would you recommend ah those are such tricky spots hope things clear up soon on an other note did they ever test him on food sensitivities my son had cowsmilk allergies for long time and out doctor said the same kids usually have eczema etc we eliminated dairy few months ago because it made him flare up we also put him on special formula we ve almost eliminated gluten he was allergy tested for common environmental triggers that he exposed to at home my husband had very severe eczema as baby too so it wasnt huge shock for this to happen well sounds like you got your bases covered then the only other thing could thing could possibly think about is to make custom sleep sack where you can zip on and off the mittens but don know what weather you have over there or how crafty you are wonder if those zipadee sleep sacks would help their hands are completely covered in those ordered zipadee zip for my month old to help him transition from being swaddled it arrives tomorrow so ca say how well he ll like it yet but wondering if it will work for your situation since their hands stay inside the way they are shaped allows babies to still roll over think they have other options for toddlers that still keep their hands inside https www sleepingbaby com pages how the zipadeezip works that good idea my mom is very crafty so she could probably make something it can get up to 40c in the summer and 40c in the winter so we have varying thicknesses of everything haha ve been debating getting couple of those actually but he hated being swaddled so do know how much he like them ve seen these he hated being swaddled though so not sure how much he enjoy this maybe ll ask around and see if anyone has one can borrow for few nights that was probably my biggest shot in the dark because not even sure if aba applied behavior analysis would work for month old or in this situation just know if was desperate would try it because know the single best thing for eczema is to not scratch and reinjure the affected area and if he was older he could work on not scratching during the day to help him learn to not scratch at night asked my husband who does aba for living and he said sensory motivation it feels good to scratch is one of the hardest motivations to overcome because there is really good substitute he thought other than physically blocking the month old from scratching there is much that can be done my son also had bad reaction to the aveeno eczema lotion called customer service and they were great and sent me refund check because bought it on amazon and didn want to deal with returning it dang it ll definitely keep this in mind for when he older though thanks ve heard of quite few people having reactions to it it almost like it one of those things that either works great or does work at all should have contacted them for refund had every eczema lotion they had ended up just giving them to friend oh well have you tried coconut oil it works wonders on skin related issues they didn make me send it back or anything and have psoriasis so tried using it myself and it worked great just use the normal aveeno baby lotion and it works just fine they also sent me coupons with my refund so got big bottle of the normal stuff okay also don kill me if you have heard this bunch but have you looked into food allergies intolerances my lo eczema is very affected by food eliminating dairy is what made my daughters eczema completely clear up also friend daughter was allergic to tree nuts and she was using coconut oil to moisturize the eczema before she figured it out have you tried more eliminations besides dairy and gluten like digested corn or egg also have you looked into the ingredients in the moisturizers to find common trigger my family has so many allergies that when we have babies 14 babies under age right now we start elimination and track foods ingredients on paper to find the issues and it sounds crappy but its actually easier than scratching till they bleed or doing steroids for too long it worked for the majority of the kids in the family those of us that figured it out before needing an allergist or specialist are you using specific formula or breastfeeding we found canola oil works better it works really well for clearing cradle cap too have you tried the zipadee zip sleep sack my son also has eczema and this sleep sack lets him turn over and have some freedom of movement while keeping his hands covered it awesome we ve eliminated gluten and dairy already as we noticed they caused flare ups we have been able to pin point anything else though we saw an allergy specialist and she tested for common environmental allergens too thankfully in canada so seeing specialist does cost us anything we ve exhausted all the steroid creams that are safe for babies and have moved to nonsteroid ointment that is working really well have compared the ingredients of all the other creams we tried that good idea ve been looking at them he hated being swaddled though so not sure how much he would like it my toddler also has severe eczema our allergist prescribed hydroxyzine which can help with itching but also put her in long sleeve footie pajamas even in the summer it does help with face but it helps prevent other scratching my daughter routine sounds similar to yours except we also have steroids for really bad flare ups it gotten better as she has gotten older had have pretty severe eczema and my triggers are fragrances mineral oils and harsh detergents my soap shampoo laundry detergents and lotions have to be fragrance free my soap and shampoo have to be sodium lauryl laureth sulfate sls free aquaphor aveeno and cerave lotions did nothing for me because most of them have mineral oil at the moment using gold bond diabetic relief which feels amazing my skin has been calm and not itchy or red for the first time in months use the all fragrance free laundry detergent it the gentlest most effective on the market think had to cut out dryer sheets and fabric softener entirely as for sleeping my lo sleeps in room with us so could sleep train him he started sleeping through the night around 10 months he 13 months now and he still wakes up once night but lays right back down and goes right back to sleep with just binky still working on getting him to go to sleep independently but making progress we also have hydroxyzine for bed time we used nonsteroid ointment we exhausted all the safe options for steroid creams and none of them worked long term it gets fairly cool at night so he always slept in long sleeve footed sleeper and light sleep sack with mittens to protect from the scratching my husband also has bad eczema so we ve always been fragrance free and use gentle detergents and soaps the sls does seem to bother my lo that good to know that it is possible for them to sleep easier hopefully we have the same results at 10months eczema and allergies go hand in hand my son skin gets better when he takes loratadine nightly but he also has severe animal allergies peanuts and tree nuts peaches cucumber and dairy even trace amounts of dairy makes his skin flair up he is and has been having issues with this since birth essentially maybe get your son allergy tested we use african black soap and the lotion and shea moisture extra moisturizing lotions and wash he is also on steroids when it gets really bad also keeping the house very cool helps heat destroys my poor boy skin oh there is prescription shampoo that his doctor prescribed to help with scalp itchiness you can also rub tea tree oil on to the scalp as well tea tree oil is an antifungal and has antibacterial properties ll go search for the shampoo when get home we used it with absolutely no itchiness after and it helped heal his scabs and eczema outbreak he been allergy tested and we do use soap at all we ve found good combination of medicines and lotions to control his flare ups he fine as long as he distracted oooo that would be awesome tea tree oil helps for very short time for him it very loose not like swaddle we got one used so maybe ask on facebook parents group or something if you do want to take the risk on the 37 that good to know will thanks my kid doesn have eczema but sleep training wasn for us either tried few times and it never worked it stressed us out lot and it only made my baby feel was abandoning her after each try she would become way more clingy anxious she now and half years old and she fall asleep just fine at bedtime after her routine bath lights out boob story during the day she is fighting naps lately but that another story hang in there know how hard it is when the kid depends on you for every nap it drove me crazy but it definitely gets better this is very reassuring ve heard horror stories about the kids who were sleep trained but also know lot of people that do do it but just slink back into the shadows because sleep training is the thing to do glad it will eventually get better good luck with napping yeah at first obsessed over mommy blogs sleep training and all those other technical terms for various parenting aspects now just wing it because it would just stress me out not doing what every parent blog was saying it right believe know my kid better and eventually we will work out what works best for us didn sleep train and my kiddo started sleeping through the night just after his second birthday thought weaning him would do it but nope he hung on for few more months after that that good to know working on weaning out one night feed he still has its exhausting slowly but surely it working just sleep training my 16 month old she doing amazing at it did know there was window lol oh good thought there was phewf most definitely there so many ways to do things now it just easier to do what feels right my son had some patches of eczema when he was younger still had one stubborn patch around his bellybutton area that won go away my husband has had eczema his whole life we ve tried doing diluted bleach baths to deal with the flare ups our doctor recommended it and my husband says it really works for his skin another method our doctor recommended was to do wet pajama dry pajama after the bleach baths and let him sleep like that all night or as long as you could keep them like that disclaimer they get sopping wet we re in canada if that matters so we followed the canadian dermatological rules for the bleach baths for kids infants have you taken him to an allergist yes we eliminated dairy and gluten while ago because we noticed they caused an increase in his flare ups he was tested for common environmental allergens as well we do bleach baths once week they do seem to help him ve never heard of the wet pajama thing though we always had to rock her to sleep was worried as well when she had to go to daycare but they just put her in crib at first she did sleep month later it took 30 minutes with crying then 15 minutes with little crying and so on and like magic it worked at home as well now we put her to bed when she is tired but still awake and within five minutes she sleeps without crying but with itching from the eczema it tough had it when was baby until about years and it returned when was 17 until was about 19 then got some antihistamine was not allergic to anything and it cleared had all kinds of ointments and crèmes about 35 40 total uv therapy got really burned ouch lymfenodes got infected ouch and this magically worked but am no docter so would know if its any help to you good luck stay strong it might sound little voodoo have you tried ostrich oil in the bath and just straight on the skin my brother had it so bad when he was baby and it helped lot used it on my daughter when she had it in random places not super bad figure if you have exhausted other options may as well try it ve never even heard of that where would find some we tried basically every sleep training method except elimination and nothing worked at daycare they patted him to sleep and at home would hold him until he had just fallen asleep then put him down and patted him until he fell asleep again the time investment to get him to sleep lessened until he eventually dismissed us from his room so he could go to sleep that was around 18mo that not too bad hi just wanted to drop few words of encouragement have had eczema my whole life including when was baby and in general have struggled with super sensitive skin it will get better promise it really does take just trying everything and seeing what works for myself had eczema as baby that faded during my adolescence until hit puberty when it came back with vengeance few ideas maybe to add to your list have huge issues with my skin whenever get hot and sweaty especially if have any fabric touching my skin so cold showers baths really help with that and of course humidify like crazy in the winter this past winter was so dry where live that just boiled water in my largest stockpot my husband said it was like sauna but it felt super great to me also didn have much success with eliminating foods but have been thinking of doing the everywell food sensitivity test it about 200 just to check also tried only cotton clothing for little while it didn do anything for me but maybe that would be helpful also making sure the nails are cut really short helps lot with not scratching until it bleeds anyway those are just few things could think of that hadn been mentioned that are age appropriate but if you ever have questions don hesitate to pm me you can find the oil on amazon might as well give it try great suggestions he always has humidifier going in his room and we have one attached to our furnace for the winter we found gluten and dairy caused flare ups so we have eliminated those he wears mittens for sleeping to help with the scratching but he figured out how to get them off it good to know it wont always be this bad ll check it out thanks hope you find something that works for you thanks now at he regressed and tries every trick in the book to make me stay in the room with him until he falls asleep lol convinced sleep and babies is just luck thing came here to suggest this also my youngest gets flare ups from egg and my oldest from dairy have you tried mustela ve heard of it never tried it though it worth try we ve been using their regular line since birth mainly because my wife has family history of eczema and we knew we had to be proactive from the start and it worked well so far however my son is only 10 weeks old so quite bit of difference in age between yours my son did have major breakout at about weeks old from the forehead down into the zone across his eyebrows and down into his cheeks we massaged his scalp with 100 coconut oil for about 15m and lightly combed out all the flakiness before taking bath and shampooing everything out using the mustela shampoo took about days to completely clear up but now his skin has been completely clear since that time we alternate water bath one day soap bath the next but follow up everyday with the mustela lotion cream and then every morning my wife wipes my son down with their no rinse water cleanser on his face around the ears and in between sweat prone areas like neck folds arm creases armpits my wife wants to eventually transition all our products to their stelatopia line which is supposed to be even better than what we are currently using swear don work for them we just followed advice from his pediatrician and family members who had remarkable success with their kids with that line initially had avoided everything by johnson amp johnson baby and my wife and had whole set of aveeno products but noticed right away it was having no effect when his skin was at its worst and we do have aquaphor but use it sparingly usually for those moisture prone places like the neck fold like said worth try there are lot of positive reviews you can check out oh wow that awesome hopefully you re able to avoid any serious flare ups we haven had any was just trying to give you some ideas thanks we were in the same situation somehow at daycare it wasnt an issue not sure if they just wear her out that much or if she was too scared uncomfortable to act out but when they told her to go to sleep she did at home she is 26 months and it whole long ritual to get her down otherwise she scratches even with the nails cut down to nothing one day oh and for the sleeping would nurse her to sleep and daycare figured out how to get her to nap by swaddling once she stopped nursing giving her stuffed animal helped to have her something to cuddle with yikes if only we had the same magic they did at day care hopefully you get some relief soon same here did you know eczema has been correlated to egg allergies it how knew to get my daughter tested yep she allergic to egg dairy gluten coconut and corn took those away and she doing much better
